content:
Hey folks! @Josh Triplett has mentioned to me that folks have been avoiding using built-in polls here because of a lack of support on mobile.

I just wanted to give everyone a heads up that basic support for polls has been implemented not long ago (zulip/zulip-mobile#4704). At this point, you can see the poll and the vote counts on mobile, and add your vote.

We have some follow-ups remaining to add mobile support for viewing who voted on a poll, editing the poll question and adding options.

I'd be interested to hear if any of the outstanding issues are deal-breakers for being able to use the native /poll functionality.

/poll what are the odds you get this question right?
25%
50%
25%
75%
cc @simulacrum, I think we should be able to retire triagebot's poll feature now :)
it... doesn't have a poll feature? the end-topic/end-meeting still seem useful to me (though could be rewritten from emoji to auto-creating polls)
